required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Retrospective Study of Neural Network Model to Dynamically Quantificate the Severity in COVID-19 Disease
clinical_study.official_title: a Retrospective Study of Neural Network Model to Dynamically Quantificate the Severity in COVID-19 Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The research aim to collect large samples of COVID-19 disease patients with clinical symptoms, laboratory and imaging examination data. Screening the biological indicators which are related to the occurrence of severe diseases. Then, investigators using artificial intelligence (AI) technology deep learning method to find a prediction model that can dynamically quantify COVID-19 disease severity.

primary_outcome.description: The performance of our prediction model is evaluated with the receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curves, areas under the curves (AUCs) and concordance index (c-index).
The calibration curves analysis is used to show error between the predicted clinical phenotype with prediction model and actual clinical phenotype.
Decision curve analysis was used to determine whether the models could be considered useful tools for clinical decisionmaking by comparing the net benefits at any threshold.

arm_group.description: The patients who were detected COVID-19 disease by RT-PCR and CT imaging.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients of COVID-19 disease confirmed by virus nucleic acid RT-PCR and CT
Exclusion Criteria:
- unconfirmed suspected cases
- Patients during pregnancy and lactation
- incomplete clinical data
- inestigators considered patients ineligible for the trial

responsible_party.investigator_title: Deputy Director,Head of Oncology department, Principal Investigator, Clinical Professor
